nav.div: Waynesboro Public Schools » COVID-19 Updates & Resources

span.a: COVID-19: What You Need To Know

span.em: »The School Nutrition and Transportation Departments have updated the School Closure Food Service Plan to be more efficient and responsive to our community. T
hank you to all of the folks who have volunteered to help with meal distribution.

span.strong: Families of Students with Disabilities Regarding School Closure

br.br: March 18, 2020 – Sign-up to Volunteer – WPS Meals Distribution

span.strong: If you are interested in participating:

li.span: Look for the available time slots
Click on the button to volunteer

span.em: The information must be reviewed BEFORE your first day of volunteering.)

li.span: Review the PowerPoint and PRINT your completion certificate
Bring the Completion Certificate to your selected site on your First Day

span.br: March 13, 2020 - WPS School Closing Plan Update

strong.span: March 23, 2020 Governor Northam: Statewide Closure of K-12 Schools

p.span: » All schools will remain closed through the end of this academic year

span.br: March 19, 2020 Governor Northam: Additional Actions to Address COVID-19

p.span: » Working with the Department of Medicaid Assistance Services, Governor Northam is increasing access to health care for Virginia’s 1.5 million Medicaid members and thousands of low-income residents

span.br: March 12, 2020 Governor Northam Declares State of Emergency

div.p: Waynesboro Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. Waynesboro Public Schools also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
